intro: Lomatopodium lessingianum, commonly known as the lesser lomatium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands. It has a fibrous root system and can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. Lomatopodium lessingianum is often found in regions with well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
